text: I know! It sucks they're gone because now things just aren't the same! D8 i don't know if you live in the states, but if so, do you remember Yogi Bear Camp Resort in Spokane? That's one of the main things I miss. Then they closed it and turned it into a private camp resort called something Springs or something like that. I was like broken hearted when that happened. :,( lol but on the bright side we still have things to remember the good days by! Like SNES! N64! ETC.! lol sorry for the paragraph

author: Name

text: Brings back memories of when I was three in Christmas of '93.  Back then, all I played was my older sister's NES, but when I was given a huge box with my first console inside with loads of accessories, I screamed with joy.  This was the first game I played while my dad kept pestering me to shut it off and watch him play with the Super Scope.  The SNES was and always will be MY first gaming console.

text: My gripe about the music of this game is that it uses the same melody line (or at least part of it) in almost every single track. You hear it in the caverns, both of the overworld themes, the castles, and even the ghost houses. I don't know how I feel about that. :/

text:
@Arc13 THIS GAME IS SO FUCKING AWESOMER BUY IT NAO!~!!!1!
